titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Kanzaki Kiichi papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kaoru Ueda

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-11T11:45-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection inventory prepared by Kay Ueda.

did.unittitle: Kanzaki Kiichi papers
did.abstract: Diaries, speeches and writings relating to Japanese immigration to the United States, and to the Japanese community in the United States. Photocopies of archival documents held at Kwansei Gakuin University's Archives in Japan.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Kwansei Gakuin University Archives (KGUA) holds the copyright to this material.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kanzaki Kiichi papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kanzaki Kiichi was the general secretary of the Zaibei Nihonjinkai (Japanese Association of America) in San Francisco (1915-1921) and became the fifth president of Kwansei Gakuin University in Japan (1940-1950).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Kanzaki Kiichi papers include photocopies of the diaries of Kanzaki (1916, 1919, 1920, and 1921), his speech manuscripts on the Pacific and Japanese immigration issue in the United States, Japanese government studies on immigration issues, and U.S. court cases regarding Japanese citizenship and its related issues.

did.unittitle: 移民調査報告 第11 (Imin chōsa hōkoku dai11), 外務省通商局 (Gaimushō tsūshōkyoku),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Immigration Study Report, Vol. 11, Ministery of Foreign Affairs of Japan. Two handwritten letters inserted. B5, 213 pp.

did.unittitle: 覚書 (棺村市民議案）) (Oboegaki (Sugimura? Shimin gian)), 桑港日本人会 棺村丈児 (Jōji Sugimura?),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memorandum (Sugimura United States citizenship proposal), Japanese Association of America, San Francisco. Inserted in "Imin chōsa hōkoku dai11." 5 sheets.

did.unittitle: Untitled,
日本移民協会横浜講習所概覧 (Nihon imin kyōkai Yokohama kōshūjo gairan), 日本移民協会 (Nihon imin kyōkai),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Overview of Yokohama Training Center," Association of Japanese Immigration. A5, 15 pp.

did.unittitle: 渡米議員団報告書 (Tobei gi'indan hōkokusho),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report of Diet delegates to the United States. A5, 38 pp.

did.unittitle: 米国西北部在留日本人発展略史 (Beikoku seihokubu zairyū Nihonjin hatten ryakushi), 連絡日本人会 (Renraku Nihonjinkai),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Summary history of Japanese residing in the Northwestern United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: During his stay in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: During his stay in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kanzaki's manuscripts for lectures, opinions, and essays.

did.unittitle: 太平洋関係調査会議に於ける移民問題の考察 (Taiheiyō kankei chōsa kaigi ni okeru imin mondai no kōsatsu)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Study on the immigration issue at Taiheiyo kanren chosa kaigi.

scopecontent.p: "To those who lament on the difficult job market."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Fuel your passion for your life."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Pacific issue, the future, and the western states in the United States.

scopecontent.p: "My personal opinion on the Pacific issue."

did.unittitle: 上記に関する講演要綱、会議報告など各種多数 (Jōki ni kansuru kōen yōkō, kaigi hōkoku nado kakushu tasū)

did.unittitle: "California and the Japanese," Kanzaki Kiichi, General Secretary of the Association of Japanese Residing in America
米国移民法上程に伴う理事会の報告書および関連書類 (Beikoku iminhō jōtei ni tomonau rijikai no hōkokusho oyobi kanrenshorui),

scopecontent.p: Board report concerning the United States immigration laws and its related documents.

did.unittitle: Ichizo Sato v. Hall, 191 Cal. 510, Cal. Supreme Court (1923)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ichizo Sato vs. Harry W. Hall, Clerk of the County of Sacramento (Supreme Court of California). A Japanese soldier who served the United States Government during the late war and who has received an honorable discharge, entitled to citizenship under the Act of Congress of May 9th, 1918.

did.unittitle: The matter of the application of Heikichi Terui for a writ of habeas corpus (the Supreme Court of the State of California)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A Japanese alien obligated to register and pay the poll tax as provided by the terms of the so-called alien poll tax of California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In the Matter of Heikichi Terui on Habeas Corpus (Crim. No. 2390, Supreme Court of California)
